entries.title: Duct tape and the camel: what I've learned from maintenance

entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Dave looked into a CPAN Testers fail for one of his modules, and to fix it he ended up fixing something in someone else's module. He's not finished yet though!
entries.title: Updating Ogg::Vorbis::Header

entries.author: tom_wyant
entries.text: Tom posted that he was going to delete Geo::Coder::Geocoder::US from CPAN, but then discussion in the comments resulted in Tom deciding to deprecate the module, and possibly delete it from CPAN at some later date.
entries.title: Retraction of Geo::Coder::Geocoder::US

entries.author: kivanc_yazan
entries.text: The recent YAPC::NA was Kivanç's first; here he shares just 5 of the things he learned. I feel he's holding back, as I'm sure Kivanç learned more than 5 things!
entries.title: 5 Things I Learned at YAPC

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: I want to encourage more first time speakers, particularly at LPW. As part of that I'm questions of good / experienced speakers. What question should I ask, and of whom?
entries.title: Learning from other/experienced speakers

entries.text: MaxMind are looking for two Perl programmers, but they need to be in the US states of Massachusetts, Minnesota, Montana, North Carolina, and Oregon, or anywhere in Canada.
entries.title: MaxMind is looking to hire 2 Perl programmers

entries.title: How to Write a Git Commit Message

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Pert of the Dancer2 series building an Ajax-enabled application, this article shows the client-side JavaScript code.
entries.title: Add and retrieve elements using jQuery + Ajax

header: After most conferences we usually see a flurry of blog posts. These can be helpful when deciding what talk videos to watch. There haven't been many post-YAPCNA this year.

So a request: when you go to a conference, please consider writing a blog post afterwards,
even just a short one. It's helpful and interesting for those of us who can't attend. And we Perl Weekly editors appreciate it too :-)
subject: Where are the YAPC::NA blog posts?
